title: Democrats Scale Back Shutdown Demands, but G.O.P. Digs In
summary: After weeks of stalemate, Senate Democrats said they were willing to reopen the government in exchange for a one-year extension of health care subsidies. Republicans ruled it out.

title: Judge Blocks National Guard From Portland and Says Trump Overstepped His Authority
summary: With her temporary block expiring, Judge Karin Immergut said the Trump administration had failed to prove that protesters were hampering President Trump’s policies.

title: Immigration Agents Arrest Man in L.A. Raid and Drive Off With His Toddler
summary: The child was later reunited with her grandmother, but the episode alarmed immigrant rights groups. The father, a U.S. citizen, faces a gun possession charge.

title: How Courts Have Ruled in Challenges to Trump’s National Guard Deployments
summary: Federal courts across the country have heard legal challenges to the mobilization of troops in Chicago, Portland, Ore., Los Angeles and other cities. Here’s how judges have ruled, so far.

title: New York Prepares for a Potential Trump Immigration Crackdown
summary: The election of Zohran Mamdani as mayor has stoked speculation that President Trump might move to send forces into the city.

title: A Decade Later, Supreme Court Is Asked to Revisit Same-Sex Marriage Decision
summary: Kim Davis, a Kentucky county clerk once jailed for refusing to issue same-sex marriage licenses, has asked the court to reconsider its landmark 2015 opinion.

title: Did Trump’s Supreme Court Tariffs Brief Include a Strategic Blunder?
summary: The justices are generally reluctant to take account of a president’s public statements. But extensive quotes from Mr. Trump in a key filing may change the legal calculus.

title: A Light in Very Dark Days: Nancy Pelosi and AIDS
summary: As Ms. Pelosi announced her retirement, she was celebrated for her long tenure in Washington. But back home, she was remembered for showing up at a terrifying moment when others turned away.

title: Who Will Replace Nancy Pelosi in Congress? London Breed Is Among Those Eyeing the Seat.
summary: Two Democrats have already announced their campaigns to replace Representative Nancy Pelosi in her San Francisco district. Ms. Breed and others may join the race soon.

title: Inside China’s Quest to Defy Aging with Longevity Labs and ‘Immortality Islands’
summary: Longevity labs, “immortality islands” and grapeseed pills are part of China’s national project to conquer aging, despite sometimes shaky science and extravagant claims.

title: James D. Watson, Co-Discoverer of the Structure of DNA, Is Dead at 97
summary: His decoding of the blueprint for life with Francis H.C. Crick made him one of the most important scientists of the 20th century. He wrote a celebrated memoir and later ignited an uproar with racist views.

title: The DNA Helix Changed How We Thought About Ourselves
summary: “The laws of inheritance are quite unknown,” Charles Darwin acknowledged in 1859. The discovery of DNA’s shape altered how we conceived of life itself.

title: Hegseth Is Purging Military Leaders With Little Explanation
summary: The moves to fire or sideline generals and admirals are without precedent in recent decades and have rattled the top brass.

title: What to Know About Trump’s Transgender Passport Policy After Supreme Court Ruling
summary: A policy that requires passports to display a person’s sex assigned at birth will come into play during renewals and first-time applications.

title: What I Learned From the ‘New Globalists’ of an Optimistic Nation
summary: Few countries are excited about globalization anymore, but Vietnam is still into it — wholeheartedly. Do the reasons go beyond economic growth?

title: In Cozying Up to Trump, Leaders Hedge Their Reliance on Moscow and Beijing
summary: President Trump has made it easier for countries that are close to Russia and China to build ties with the United States. Those countries are embracing the opportunity.

title: Trump Signals Openness to Exempting Hungary from Russian Oil Sanctions
summary: Despite a chummy relationship, new U.S. penalties on Russian energy were likely to be a sticking point as President Trump and Prime Minister Viktor Orban of Hungary met.

title: Is A.I. a Journalist or Just a Newsroom Tool?
summary: A.I. has set off industrywide soul-searching about its potential and pitfalls.

title: The Farmers’ Almanac Succumbs to the Digital Age
summary: One of two major American almanacs is ceasing publication after more than two centuries of predicting the weather and offering tidbits of wisdom.

title: Canada Culls Hundreds of Ostriches as a Court and a Kennedy Fail to Save Them
summary: The birds, exposed to the avian flu, were killed after Canada’s Supreme Court refused to hear an appeal and a rescue effort by Robert F. Kennedy Jr. fell short.

title: Why Democrats Could Win the Redistricting War
summary: Amending state constitutions seemed like a long shot, but Virginia’s move suggests more blue states may be willing to try, opening new possibilities.

title: A Democrat Pushing 80 Confronts the Young(er) and Restless
summary: A fight brewing in Massachusetts could preview Democrats’ age battles.

title: Just How Bad Was Trump’s Very Bad Night?
summary: Ezra Klein and Aaron Retica discuss whether affordability is the Democrats’ winning message, Trump’s politics of cruelty and how liberalism can win right now.

title: Trump Is Resurrecting the Gatsby Era. The Hangover Could Be Brutal.
summary: Donald Trump’s recent Gatsby party encapsulates this moment of economic peril.

title: Rise in Kidney Disease Tied to Other Chronic Conditions, Study Finds
summary: Rates of the disease have been rising for decades, driven in part by diabetes and high blood pressure.

title: New York State Officials Approve Proposal for Controversial Underwater Gas Pipeline
summary: The contentious proposal, previously rebuffed by state regulators who expressed environmental concerns, was deemed acceptable on Friday.

title: Virginia Teen Narrowly Defeats His Former Civics Teacher in County Election
summary: Cameran Drew, 19, defeated his former high school government teacher, Kenneth Bell, by 10 votes for a seat on the Surry County Board of Supervisors this week. There are no hard feelings.

title: Biden Warns of a ‘Very, Very Dark Moment’ as He Hits Out at Trump
summary: The former president, now a far less popular figure in his party, appeared in Nebraska for an overtly political speech that slammed his successor.
